intro: Lotononis listioides, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
